text: it is amazing what we're able to
empathize with someone we've never met
we can feel for someone through their
story being shared on the internet you'd
think this great surge in empathy and
connectedness would make the world a
happier place but there's a dark side to
empathy we have long Associated empathy
with a myriad of positive emotions but
today we're uncovering the unfortunate
Dark Truth About empathy because it's
important to recognize that while aathy
is valuable too much of it can lead to
emotional burnout blurred boundaries and
even manipulation by discussing this our
goal is to help people find a healthy
balance and protect their mental and
emotional well-being while still being
compassionate Devil's Advocate we can
practice empathy but being empathetic
isn't a choice when you hear gossip or
rants it's possible that instead of
sympathizing for your friend you may
feel compelled into taking into account
not just your friend story but also the
person they're talking about after all
an empathetic person can't help but
relate in some way to both parties
unfortunately you may end up coming
across as Playing devil's advocate and
instead of feeling supported your friend
May accuse you of defending the other
party empathy is a great feature to
nurture in all of your relationships but
being empathetic might not always be
helpful
unreciprocated we we aren't all as
empathetic as one another when there is
an imbalance of empathy in a
relationship you may end up feeling like
you are the only one putting in the
effort to relate to them and their
struggles but some people are just more
empathetic than others it can come down
to the way you were raised your life
experience or even genetics it's true
your biology can affect your level of
empathy psychiatrist Henrik Walter
published a study in which he indic ated
that there is evidence that oxytocin and
dopamine play a role in how empathetic
you are in relationships when one has a
higher level of empathy than the other
it can sometimes lead to feelings of
loneliness when we're constantly taking
on the heavy emotions of our friends and
loved ones it can lead to relationship
burnout of course your relationships can
benefit from empathy sharing your
partner's Joys and concerns can bring
you closer together and can help a lot
in conflict resolution a study published
in Trends in cognitive science points
out that empathy can be really helpful
in relationships and does benefit your
relationship satisfaction however the
study goes on to reveal that while
empathy is great in certain contexts it
can be extremely damaging in others for
example if you are an empathic person
and your partner is experiencing a lot
of negative emotions that negativity can
spread to you like an infection after
all misery loves company another example
is if your partner is having doubts and
worries about your relationship and
thinks it should end as an empathic
person and being able to feel what they
feel and understand their perspective
you might agree with them rather than
fight for the
relationship emotional availability
empathetic people are extremely
emotionally available that sounds great
because it's nice to be a friend or
partner who people can rely on
unfortunately this also means that your
emotions are available to be used
against you the people around you may
take advantage of the fact that you're
more likely to agree to things despite
it not being very beneficial to you or
will be more forgiving of them because
you can understand their point of view
and see where they're coming from
similarly empathetic people who have
suffered abuse can simultaneously feel
traumatized and hurt over the abuse
while also r alizing and feeling sorry
for their
abuser as an empathic person you take on
all of the strong feelings of your
significant other friends and family the
more you're there for people the more
you risk becoming completely emotionally
burnt out especially when you don't have
any boundaries in place vicarious trauma
the more empathetic you are the more
likely it is that other people's trauma
will affect you vicarious trauma is
usually a challenge for First Responders
and therapists who are put in the
position to deal with trauma victims
often as the name implies vicarious
trauma is when you empathetically feel
for some of the trauma and pain of the
people you're treating as someone who
has a great deal of empathy and who
wants to help people often you may find
yourself faced with vicarious trauma and
without being in a field like therapy
you may be ill equipped to deal with it
in the age of the internet viar trauma
can take a new form in people who focus
on global humanitarian issues a lot it's
great to want to help people and spread
awareness of global issues but the more
invested you become the more it will
negatively affect you it's great to
fight against Injustice but you have to
be careful that taking on all of that
trauma doesn't make you more bitter and
angry after all we need to be optimistic
to believe we can achieve change if you
don't have trauma of your own being
exposed to other people's trauma can
make you quite sensitive to the things
that trigger the person you are
empathizing with for example if they
went through sexual assault you may feel
especially disgusted or defensive when
it comes to sex in your own life this is
another example of empathy being
unhelpful taking on that trauma doesn't
lessen the trauma for the other person
as you mirror someone else you expose
yourself to the emotions they feel
whether it be their sadness anger or
even shame you may even feel responsible
for the trauma they went through not
only is this not helpful it's actively
harmful it damages your mental
well-being and it may also be quite
insulting or offensive for the person
who actually went through the abuse
vicarious trauma can also lead to
burnout there is only so much a person
can take before they're completely
emotionally overwhelmed a study
examining vicarious trauma empathy and
burnout in therapies found that
vicarious trauma and empathy can make
therapists vulnerable to burnout and if
that empathy and Trauma go unchecked
they start to show signs of getting
burnout so if you're the person with the
open heart to takes on the pain and
Trauma of the people in your life you
need some form of Defense in order to
not burn out is confidence the key being
empathic isn't really a choice so we
need ways to ensure that our empathy
isn't used against us while still being
a caring
individual when taking on those feelings
look out for Clues as to whether you are
taking on too much do you find yourself
ruminating on emotions is there a
practical purpose in holding on to these
emotions practice
mindfulness and as someone who is
empathic be aware of the fact that you
are susceptable to people taking
advantage of you increasing your
confidence will help you stop feeling
responsible when someone is trauma
dumping on you and allow you to avoid
burdening yourself with too many
negative emotions building your
confidence can also allow you to act
with more compassion rather than empathy
which allows you to be more goal
oriented and helpful to the other
person everyone should have some empathy
compassion requires some empathy but we
shouldn't forget that empathy isn't the
only thing that makes us
good having being sympathy and being
compassionate are often more helpful
than being
empathetic there isn't anything wrong
with being empathic especially because
it isn't always a choice but as empathic
people we should be able to monitor our
empathy and ensure that it isn't making
things worse for
ourselves you don't have to feel worse
to make someone feel better if you
